html: wild beasts/doleful creatures/owls/he-goats/jackals. Isaiah identifies creatures of the night that are ritually impure and are not domesticated. Such creatures will inhabit desolate Babylon (34:13-14; Jer. 50:39), even taking over the abandoned houses. John the Revelator wrote that "Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and is become the habitation of devils, and the hold of every foul spirit, and a cage of every unclean and hateful bird" (Rev. 18:2).
